name: A Conquista (The Conquering)
description:
In my language, Portuguese, the word ‘Conquest’ is also used in the context of love relationships. We say things like: ‘I want to conquer you’ meaning ‘I love you, and want you to love me in return.’

I think this a funny way to describe love because the realm of love relationships is perhaps the most colonised ones, no?

We are always told how to love, who to love and who not to love. 

This painting consequently tells the tale of my complex love life. I am a recovering codependent and I feel stuck every time ‘I am in love’ because I simply cannot be myself.

I am addicted to love because I am trying to fill in a void of rejection caused by my parents. I want to be loved.

Love is a power dynamics game and soon one of us will be beheaded. 
Ripped apart. 

I guess in this inevitable tension that comes with love, all we can hope for is to be the ones holding the head.

This painting is a homage to all men that I loved.

I didn’t know how to love you because nobody loved me.
